subtitle: hi I'm Simon Jacobsen welcome to
meaningful Monday's where we answer your
personal questions the question for this
week is I have to be busy all the time
or I feel uncomfortable how can I slow
down we have a concept called
workaholics people who are busy all the
time simply because they feed off of
work all we have people are busy all the
time because they're escaping now the
famous line some dance to remember some
dance to forget some work in order to
remember and some work in order to
forget either way frankly a person
shouldn't be working all day and all
night there are other things in life and
it could very well be as they say life
is what happens to you while you're busy
making other plans it's critical to
define which is the tool because if it's
someone who's escaping and work is
basically a way of escaping life by not
having to engage with anything personal
or engage at home and family or engage
in looking inside yourself keep yourself
busy like I met a guy at other day said
to me I haven't thought about myself for
three years because too painful I don't
even want to go there he keeps himself
busy obviously that's a very unhealthy
thing not only is an unhealthy it'll
come back to haunt you because that
voice inside of you is going to demand
its day so I'm not sure what motivates
you but the different things motivate
different people you got to find
yourself a way to get out of this trap
I'm a big believer that the best
solution to problems is never through
the negative the best ways to find an
alternative for example someone's
wandering in the desert and they're
dying of thirst so they'll drink
whatever comes their way if it's toxic
they may drink that but if you give them
a good drink a healthy drink fresh cup
of water they'll drink that most
addictions most escapes is some relief
from some pain within a person and we
grab whatever comes our way sometimes it
becomes workaholic sometimes that come
being busy all the time so the key is to
find something that's an alternative
where you can put something that you
enjoy that pulls you out of that zone to
just tell a person
don't be in pain don't relieve yourself
of the pain don't escape from it it's
not enough off to find a positive
alternative so if you're feeling that
you're busy all the time and you want to
slow down which is clearly implied in
this question then don't just slow down
and say I'm not going to do anything
today find something that you can enjoy
find a friend go for a walk go count
Birds whatever it is catch butterflies I
mean that as an example of whatever it
takes this is true across the board
whether it's work whatever it is that is
consuming someone finding good
alternatives that a break in the day
some way that you can find another
release now if it's a person is a work a
holic let's say for healthy reasons they
just love to work and they're just
productive all the time in general it's
good to have some diversity I would say
it's a harder situation about a person
like that I don't think would write this
question they would not be looking to
slow down because they think it's a
great thing and they and they may be
writing I still think people like that
should slow down because what do they do
with your personal life where they do
with their spouses with their children
they're busy working all the time and
never slow down where do they have time
for them own souls are they able to read
a book can they just enjoy the a nice
spring day can they smell the flowers
etc so regardless everybody needs times
that's how the machine works to be in
constant hyper mode and that helps we
all need a time where we relax and if
we're not relaxing it often comes back
to bite us one way or another the key
thing is to find ways that are
alternatives that you don't feel like
you're wasting time because you're not
working you feel that you're doing
something equally productive but it's
not with the same intensity and the same
pressure that pure work demands of us
thank you for watching I welcome your
personal questions please have a
meaningful week
